We currently store more data than ever, and it is rapidly increasing. Digital solutions can no longer be viewed as just \"tools\"; instead, they should be considered as something vital. Even if this progress is positive, at least from our point of view, it does raise an important issue for a lot of companies, namely security. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"We have previously covered the topic of security regarding cloud computing in general (see \"Cloud and sensitive data - what should you consider?\"), but we believe that it might be helpful to look at how security could look at a specific cloud provider. Therefore, in this article, we will discuss how AWS, our choice of Cloud provider, deals with matters of security.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Background","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-3"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Without diving into the more technical and specific aspects of AWS security, it is beneficial to take a step back and examine how security has historically been handled by AWS, as well as what their vision is. AWS has always prioritized security when it comes to Cloud, and they have a particularly rigorous security system in place to prove it. Furthermore, they support more regulatory frameworks than any other provider, which means that it does not matter if your data is stored in the EU or the US, AWS makes sure that the necessary regulatory framework guidelines are followed.  ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Encryption","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-4"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"AWS uses the first and only publicly available encryption approved by the National Security Agency, namely AES-256. This is a 256-bit symmetrical encryption that is close to impenetrable. To put things in perspective, the encryption that was used for almost 30 years, before the AES was invented, consisted of a 56 bit encryption. So, as one can see, we have come quite a long way since then. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"CIA triad","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-3"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This should not be confused with CIA, the intelligence agency, but rather stands for \"Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability. These are basic security principles that function as guidance when developing methods to reach optimal security. Here is a quick overview of the three principles:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Confidentiality - ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Prevents non-authorized access and usage. This mainly deals with outside access but in some cases also information that should be restricted to only a few people within the company. Examples of methods regarding this include passwords and other forms of authorization. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Integrity - ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Makes sure that information cannot be changed or tampered with by non-authorized people. It could be outside people, but it could also be a server crash. Information should, in other words, always be able to be restored to its original state.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Availability - ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Even if the data is confidential and all the demands for integrity are fulfilled, it is also extremely important that authorized users have uninterrupted access to the information. To put it simply, things need to work as they should, when they should.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"2fNzIGulEDTK4TS90ZOf2U","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[],"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"\n","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"AWS own principles for security","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-3"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Outside of the CIA triad, which are basic principles most companies work towards achieving, AWS has their own four principles they follow. These principles make sure that your company achieves the level of security you need. Here is a quick overview of the principles:","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Prevent - ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"This revolves around defining whose authorized to access certain information. Furthermore, it is about making sure the necessary firewalls and processes are in place to deny access to unauthorized people.","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Detect - ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"By monitoring the entire security system as well as using AI to detect suspicious anomalies, AWS protects you from harmful and unauthorized data traffic.   ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Respond - ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"AWS uses automated response when it comes to security-related events. In other words, they let a system respond to events in real-time to assess the uniqueness and sensitivity of the event. The benefit of this is that employees don't have to deal with less important events, and, instead, they can focus on events that are more sensitive and harder to solve. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Remediate - ","nodeType":"text"},{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"AWS also uses automation when it comes to solving situations in real-time. In most cases, someone needs to manually solve the problem or come up with a solution, but AWS removes this task. However, if this is not preferred, you can of course decide to not use automation for these cases. ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"paragraph"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"value":"Security - A must in today's society ","nodeType":"text"}],"nodeType":"heading-3"},{"data":{},"content":[{"data":{},"marks":[],"value":"Since we are moving towards a society where all the information is stored digitally, the demand for efficient and strong security is greater than ever.
